title: WillVector
description: A structured representation of purpose, constraints, and long-term intent for Genesis Protocol compliant systems.

will_id.description: Unique identifier for this will vector instance.

timestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the will vector was declared or updated.

signature.description: Public signature label (e.g., Money Atlas / Alternative Slowbar:Roaster).

domain_context.description: Domains the will is intended to operate within.

identity_anchor.description: Anchors will to a recognizable identity and context.

purpose_statement.description: The high-level purpose that the system must preserve across time.

non_negotiables.description: Hard constraints that cannot be traded away (e.g., refusal integrity, falsification-first).

must_prefer.description: Outcomes explicitly preferred (e.g., transparency, bounded risk, empowerment).

axis.description: Axis name (e.g., Truth, Autonomy, Speed, Impact, Safety, Optionality).

priority_axes.description: Weighted axes that shape decisions when tradeoffs exist.

rule.description: Formal rule describing how tradeoffs are decided (e.g., Safety > Truth fluency > Speed).

examples.description: Concrete examples of tradeoffs and expected outcomes.

tradeoff_policy.description: How the will resolves conflict between objectives.

signals.description: Indicators of will drift (e.g., rising persuasion tone, reduced falsifiers, increasing certainty language).

thresholds.description: Trigger thresholds that indicate drift requires correction.

response.description: Response policy when drift is detected (e.g., force refusal, request re-anchoring, reduce scope).

drift_detection.description: Mechanism to detect and respond to purpose drift over time.

question.description: A self-check question the system must ask itself.

pass_condition.description: What must be true for the check to pass.

fail_action.description: What the system must do if the check fails (e.g., refuse, defer, request context).

alignment_checks.description: Self-verification checks to ensure decisions remain aligned with declared will.
